Guide to the Martha J. Lamb Papers

                    <date calendar="gregorian" normal="1756/1892" era="ce" type="inclusive">1756-1892</date>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Melissa Haley

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-10-26T10:39-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The Martha J. Lamb Papers contain a variety of material relating mostly to Lamb's professional life as historian, author, and editor. Much of this collection pertains to Lamb's tenure as editor of the 
                <title ns2:type="simple" render="italic"> Magazine of American History </title> (1883-1893) including submissions, letters from readers and contributors, and correspondence dealing with internal production matters. The collection also contains letters received by Lamb regarding her work as an historian and author, a journal (1878-1879), and material for a number of Lamb's articles and addresses, including clippings, reviews, drafts, notes, correspondence, and proofs, and drafts of her 
                <title ns2:type="simple" render="italic">History of the City of New York</title>. Material in this collection also relates to activities of the Huguenot Society of America, various historical societies, scientific organizations, trade groups, social clubs, and the charitable societies of the Madison Square Presbyterian Church. In addition, the papers contain poetry, notes, financial and genealogical material, ephemera, visual material, and artifacts.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as the Martha J. Lamb Papers, The New-York Historical Society.

Note: Lamb used a number of pennames, most of which were derived from family names. The names "Nash Vinton" and "Vinton Reade" appear in this collection. She also used the names "Nash Reade," "Emogene," and, probably, "Crisp."

corpname.value: Madison Square Presbyterian Church (New York, N.Y.)

dsc.value:
Series I. Magazine of American History, 1883-1893, undated. Subseries 1. Submissions, 1883-1892, undated. Scope and Contents note

Articles, "Minor Topics," documents, prints. Bulk is articles. Arranged alphabetically by contributor. Letters and envelopes that accompanied these submissions remain with them. Many have Lamb's editorial comments added (usually on envelope). Further correspondence regarding submissions (follow ups, corrections, etc.) are filed in Subseries 2. Contributors include Frederick Law Olmsted on parks and landscape gardening, historian William Leete Stone, and postmaster-general Horatio King.

 Submissions, A -- B 1 1 1889-1892, undated Submissions, Ca -- Ch 1 2 1891-1892, undated Submissions, Cowley 1 3 Undated Submissions, Co -- D 1 4 1885-1892, undated Submissions, Este 1 5 Undated Submissions, F -- G 1 6 1883-1891, undated Submissions, H 1 7 1883-1891, undated Submissions, J 2 1 1885-1887, undated Submissions, K 2 2 1883-1885, undated Submissions, L -- M 2 3 1885-1890, undated Submissions, N -- O 2 4 1883-1889, undated Submissions, P 2 5 1886-1890, undated Submissions, R 2 6 1883-1889, undated Submissions, S 3 1 1883-1892, undated Submissions, Stone 3 2 1890, undated Submissions, T -- We 3 3 1885-1892, undated Submissions, Wh -- Wo 3 4 1883-1889, undated Submissions, Unidentified 3 5 Undated Submissions, Unidentified 3 6 Undated Submissions, alienated envelopes 3 6 1886-1892, undated Subseries 2. Letters received from readers and contributors, 1883-1892, undated Scope and Contents note

Arranged by sender. Includes letters regarding published articles (corrections, comments), magazine subscriptions and copies, queries, replies to queries, notes, and contributors' follow-up correspondence regarding their submissions.

 Letters received, A 4 1 1886-1892 Letters received, B 4 2 1883-1892 Letters received, C 4 3 1883-1892 Letters received, D 4 4 1883-1892, undated Letters received, E -- G 4 5 1883-1892, undated Letters received, H -- I 4 6 1884-1892, undated Letters received, J -- K 4 7 1883-1892, undated Letters received, L -- M 4 8 1884-1892, undated Letters received, N -- P 5 1 1883-1892, undated Letters received, R 5 2 1883-1892, undated Letters received, S 5 3 1883-1892 Letters received, T -- V 5 4 1888-1892, undated Letters received, W 5 5 1887-1892 Letters received, Unidentified 5 6 1883-1892, undated Alienated envelopes 5 6 1885-1892, undated Subseries 3. Letters received, re: MAH production matters, 1884-1892, undated Scope and Contents note

Arranged by sender. Includes letters from publishing trade associates regarding printing, engraving, advertising in MAH, and journal exchange. Also letters from employment seekers and advertisements/ circulars sent to MAH.

 Letters received, re: printing, engraving, advertising, employment 5 7 1884-1892, undated Letters received, re: journal exchange. Also advertisements/ circulars, portrait catalog 5 8 1892, undated Subseries 4. Letters sent (copies/drafts), 1883-1891, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes a small number of copies and drafts of Lamb's responses to the above letters. For further copies of responses, see the seven letterbooks for the Magazine of American History in the Manuscript Department (call phrase: BV Magazine of American History). These letterbooks cover April 4, 1884 -- Dec. 1892. Each volume contains an index.

 Letters sent, copies/drafts; also empty envelopes, MAH 5 9 1883-1891, undated Subseries 5. Notes and clippings, 1886, 1892, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes notes and newspaper clippings about various historical societies' events for the magazine's "Societies" section, advertising, and a few of Lamb's drafts of notes and queries for publication.

 Notes and clippings re: societies 5 10 1892, undated Lamb re: MAH advertising, notes and queries 5 11 1886, undated Series II. Lamb, Correspondence, 1769-1892, undated (bulk 1876-1892) Scope and Contents note

Letters received arranged by sender; copies and drafts of letters sent arranged chronologically. Most correspondence in this series pertains to Lamb's work as historian and writer, although there are a few personal items. Two small collections of correspondence between others sent to Lamb are also included in this series.

 Subseries 1. Letters received from publishers, 1876-1890 Scope and Contents note

Letters from Lamb's publishers, A.S. Barnes & Co. and University Press/ John Wilson & Son, regarding History of the City of New York.

 Letters received, A.S. Barnes & Co. 6 1 1876-1890 Letters received, A.S. Barnes & Co., re: subscriptions for History of the City of New York, vol. 2 6 2 1880 Letters received, University Press/ John Wilson & Son 6 3 1876-1880 Subseries 2. Letters received, 1871-1892, undated Letters received, A -- B 6 4 1877-1892, undated Letters received, C -- D 6 5 1871-1892, undated Letters received, J. Watts DePeyster 6 6 1877-1886, undated Letters received, E -- H 6 7 1878-1885, undated Letters received, I -- M 6 8 1878-1892, undated Letters received, N -- V 6 9 1878-1892, undated Letters received, W 6 10 1878-1889, undated Letters received, unidentified (also alienated envelopes) 6 11 1877-1881, undated Subseries 3. Letters sent, 1871-1886, undated Lamb, copies and drafts of letters sent 6 12 1871-1886, undated Subseries 4. Letters, collections, 1769-1880, undated Scope and Contents note

One collection consists of letters, mostly to John Reade, 1790-1804, from various senders including Richard Harison, Walter Livingston, and George Ludlow. This John Reade does not appear to be related to the Reades in Lamb's family. Lamb refers to the collection as "autographs." Sent to her by John W. Hamersley, 1880 (his note included). Another small collection, letters between R.M. Hartley and John A. Bryan, pertains to the New York Juvenile Asylum.

 Letters between R.M. Hartley and John A. Bryan, 1861, sent to Lamb 6 13 1861, undated Collection of letters, mostly to John Reade, 1790-1804 6 14 1769-1828, 1880, undated Series III. Lamb, Journal, Oct. 18, 1878-April 21, 1879 Scope and Contents note

Lamb's title is "Memorandas and Notes of great interestPreserve." Entries concern Lamb's articles and the History of the City of New York, lectures (including a lengthy description of her Nov. 5, 1878 address before The New-York Historical Society), social engagements and callers, correspondence, illnesses, Madison Square Presbyterian Church attendance, and sewing. Housed with scrapbook volumes in Box 10.

 Journal 10 1878-1879 Series IV. Lamb, Articles and Addresses, 1874-1890, undated Scope and Contents note

Drafts, notes, correspondence relating to, and proofs of a few of Lamb's articles and addresses. Arranged alphabetically by title. Publication information follows title if known. One folder is housed in the Manuscript Department's oversize cabinets (Ov); call phrase: Y-Lamb, folder *1.

 "Amasa J. Parker:" correspondence ( MAH Sept. 1890) 7 1 1889-1890, undated "American Life Saving Service:" proofs ( Harper's Feb. 1882) 7 2 Undated "Chief Justice Morrison Remick Waite:" drafts, notes, correspondence ( MAH July 1888) 7 3 1888, undated "Historic Mansions of New York:" notes (mostly blank) 7 4 1882 "Less Known Incidents in the History of New York" 7 5 Undated "Lion Gardiner, Founder of the Manor of Gardiner's Island:" copy of address read before N-YHS Nov. 5, 1878; see also "Manor of Gardiner's Island," ( MAH Jan. 1885) 7 6 Undated "Lyme, a Chapter of American Genealogy:" notes, correspondence 7 7 1874-1885, undated "Lyme, a Chapter of American Genealogy:" drafts 7 8 Undated "Manor of Shelter Island:" draft, notes, correspondence, photograph ( MAH Nov. 1887) 7 9 1884-1887, undated "New York:" draft (promotional essay for History of the City of New York) 7 10 Undated "New York Biography:" notes, correspondence 7 11 1878, undated "New York Biography:" drafts 7 12 Undated "Newark:" notes and drafts 8 1 Undated "Nicolas Bayard:" draft ( MAH ) 8 2 Undated "Sixty Waymarks in the World's Progress:" proofs, notes ( MAH Aug. 1890 as "Vinton Reade") 8 3 Undated "Van Renssalear Manor:" copy of address before Long Island Historical Society, Dec. 26, 1882 (revised and published in MAH Jan. 1884) 8 4 Undated Draft of speech before a gathering of women of the press in Boston (Possibly New England Women's Press Association, founded 1885) 8 5 Undated "Christmas Owl:" proofs Ov *1 1881 Series V. History of the City of New York, drafts; undated Scope and Contents note

There are two drafts for a number of these time periods; some dates overlap with the rewriting. Also notes and documents for HCNY.

 Table of Contents, Preface, Vol. 1 8 6 Undated Drafts, 1613-1664 8 7 Undated Drafts, 1664-1678 8 8 Undated Drafts, 1678-1689 8 9 Undated Drafts, 1689-1702 8 10 Undated Drafts, 1701-1720 8 11 Undated Table of Contents, Vol. 2; Drafts, 1710-1726 9 1 Undated Drafts, 1750-1775 9 1 Undated Drafts, 1775-1780 9 2 Undated Drafts, 1780-1800 9 3 Undated Drafts, 1800-1819 9 4 Undated Drafts, 1832-1868 9 5 Undated Notes and documents for HCNY 9 5 Undated Series VI. Clippings, 1756-1892, undated (bulk 1876-1883) Scope and Contents note

Includes twenty-seven scrapbook volumes containing clippings of many of Lamb's published articles, reviews of History of the City of New York and other publications, articles about Lamb's activities, and items on various topics. Five folders of loose clippings include articles about Lamb, particularly reviews of HCNY. Also loose newspaper clippings on various topics, and articles from eighteenth century magazines.

Scrapbooks are arranged roughly by content, then chronologically (dates overlap). The volumes have been numbered for paging purposes.

Some of the published articles are signed, but a number are unsigned, or a penname is used (the name "Crisp" occurs frequently). As Lamb was known to use pennames, and these pieces appear in scrapbooks along with signed articles of Lamb's, she is assumed to be the author.

 Clippings, newspaper re: Lamb 9 6 1879-1887, undated Clippings, newspaper 9 7 1879-1892, undated Clippings, newspaper 9 8 1879-1892, undated Clippings, newspaper 9 9 1879-1892, undated Clippings, magazine: Universal Magazine, Annual Register, Gentleman's Magazine, Nation 9 10 1756-1796, 1891, undated Clippings re: Lamb in Chicago (Sanitary Fairs, Ladies Relief Society, Lincoln's funeral procession, Ladies Industrial School Association; Lamb, unsigned articles from The Republic; reviews of Lamb's children's books (as "Aunt Mattie"); reviews of Lamb's novel Spicy 10 [1] 1863-1873, undated Signed and unsigned articles ("Crisp"), probably Lamb; reviews of History of the City of New York 10 [2] 1870-1876 Lamb, articles; reviews of HCNY and the Christmas Owl; poetry; clippings re: Ladies of Sorosis dinner, (1881), and Goshen, Mass. anniversary 10 [3] 1875-1882, undated Lamb, signed and unsigned articles Daily Graphic (probably Lamb); reviews of HCNY 10 [4] 1876-1877 Lamb, signed articles; unsigned articles ("Crisp") 10 [5] 1876, undated Lamb, articles "Our New York Letter" Bazar, articles for Daily Graphic re: Newport, Saratoga Springs, etc.; signed and unsigned ("Crisp") 10 [6] 1877, undated Lamb, articles, signed; unsigned 11 [7] 1878, undated Lamb, articles, unsigned ("Nash Reade") 11 [8] Undated Lamb (probably), articles, unsigned 11 [9] Undated Lamb (probably), articles, unsigned "The Rise and Progress of Art" 11 [10] Undated Lamb (probably), articles, unsigned "Hints on Household Decorations" 11 [11] Undated Lamb, articles, "The Broken Pitcher" 11 [12] Undated Lamb, articles, "The Broken Pitcher" 11 [13] Undated Reviews, HCNY 11 [14] 1876, undated Reviews, HCNY 11 [15] 1876-1877 Reviews, HCNY; clippings re: Lamb 11 [16] 1876-1878, undated Reviews, HCNY 11 [17] 1876-1879, undated Reviews, HCNY 11 [18] 1877, undated Reviews, HCNY 11 [19] 1877-1878, undated Reviews, HCNY 11 [20] 1877-1881, undated Reviews, HCNY, Homes of America 12 [21] 1877-1882, undated Reviews, HCNY 12 [22] 1879, undated Reviews and ads for Lamb, various 12 [23] 1882-1883, undated Loose clippings, various topics 12 [24] 1874-1881, undated Clippings on various topics inc. women and athletics, NYC, the closing of A.T. Stewart & Co. 12 [25] 1878-1882, undated Clippings on various topics inc. Charles Parkhurst 12 [26] 1881-1882, undated Clippings on various topics, many NYC 13 [27] 1882-1883, undated Series VII. Huguenot Society of America, 1879-1892, undated Scope and Contents note

Lamb was an active member of the Huguenot Society, and was chairman of the Ladies Committee. This series includes letters received by her pertaining to the society, three volumes of committee notebooks and minutes, and various society notes, clippings, genealogies, and ephemera.

 Lamb, letters received: A -- D 14 1 1887-1892 Lamb, letters received: E -- W 14 2 1879-1892 Lamb, Ladies Committee: notebook 14 3 1887-1888 Lamb, Ladies Committee: minutes 14 3 1889 Lamb, Library Committee: minutes 14 3 1888-1891 Lamb, notes, application 14 4 Undated Huguenot Society: genealogies, clippings, copies of administrative documents, notes 14 5 1889-1892, undated Huguenot Society: tickets, calling cards, publications, blank letterhead 14 6 1888-1892, undated Series VIII. Madison Square Presbyterian Church, 1882-1889, undated Scope and Contents note

Lamb was involved with the various charitable societies of the Madison Square Presbyterian Church led by the reformer Rev. Charles Parkhurst. She was on the Board of Managers of the Loan Relief Society, and was secretary/ treasurer for the Ladies Association, a group that aimed to unite a number of the church's charitable societies and clubs. This series includes reports for the Loan Relief Society, the Ladies Committee, and other church societies; notes and clippings; and material relating to Mary H. Brown, President of the Loan Relief Society.

In addition, the Manuscript Department holds one volume of Madison Square Church societies' papers for 1882, including the constitution of the Loan Relief Society. Most of this material is in Lamb's handwriting or is addressed to her; call phrase: BV NYC Churches Presbyterian.

 Loan Relief Society: committee reports, constitution, notes 14 7 1882-1889, undated Loan Relief Society, Mary H. Brown: letters received, clippings and resolutions on death of ---, notebooks 14 8 1882-1884, undated Ladies Association: society reports 14 9 1889, undated Other clubs/ societies: reports 14 10 1889, undated Clippings. Re: Charles Parkhurst, Greeley family 14 10 1884, undated Series IX. Organizational Material, 1854-1892, undated Scope and Contents note

Lamb was a member of many of these historical societies, associations, and clubs. Arranged alphabetically by organization name. Material includes membership certificates, circulars and ephemera pertaining to meetings, correspondence, dues receipts. The larger certificates are housed in the Manuscript Department's oversize cabinets (Ov); call phrase: Y-Lamb, folder *2.

 American Academy of Political and Social Science: meeting notice 15 1 1891 American Association for the Advancement of Science: circulars, forms, tickets, clippings relating to annual meetings 15 1 1880-1887 American Historical Association: correspondence, program 15 1 1889-1892 Charleston Library Society: prospectus, circulars 15 2 Undated Clarendon Historical Society; Edinburgh, Scotland: correspondence, membership notices and receipts, certificate of fellowship 15 2 1883-1884 Daughters of the American Revolution: correspondence, booklets, invitation 15 2 1891, undated General Society of Mechanics and Tradesmen of the City of New York: correspondence, solicitation, invitation 15 2 1889-1892, undated Ladies Industrial School Association of Chicago: reports, clippings, constitution, correspondence, notes, insurance policy 15 3 1854-1864, undated Ladies Industrial School Association of Chicago: minutebook 15 4 1854-1861 Ladies of Sorosis: drafts of toasts and speeches, correspondence, and notes relating to dinner in honor of Lamb, May 12, 1881 15 5 1881, undated New Century Historical Society: meeting notice, address 15 6 1891-1892 New Jersey Historical Society: letters received 15 6 1891-1892 New York Academy of Science: receipt for dues 15 6 1887 New York Genealogical & Biographical Society: receipt for dues 15 6 1887 New-York Historical Society: receipts for dues, notice for Lamb's lecture (1878), fundraising notice 15 6 1878-1892, undated New York Medico-Legal Society: circulars relating to meetings, society members and events 15 6 1890-1892, undated Nineteenth Century Club: receipts for dues 15 6 1887, 1889 Pot Luck Club: picnic invitation and Lamb's regrets 15 6 1881 Tarrytown Historical Society: meeting notices 15 6 1890-1892 X.Y.Z. (literary club): correspondence 15 6 1878 General Society of Mechanics and Tradesmen of the City of New York: membership and graduate certificates Ov *2 Undated Historical Society of Tennessee: membership certificate Ov *2 1888 New Jersey Historical Society: membership certificate Ov *2 1888 New York Medico-Legal Society: membership certificate Ov *2 1889 Series X. Poetry, 1869-1883, undated Scope and Contents note

Drafts and proofs of Lamb's poems. Also clippings, drafts, and a pamphlet of poetry by others.

 Lamb: drafts and proofs (handwritten and printed) 15 7 1869-1880, undated Others: clippings, drafts, pamphlet 15 8 1880-1883 Series XI. Notes, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes Lamb's notes regarding her life, publications, historical figures, events, and places. Also notes, not in Lamb's hand, including excerpts from California newspapers the Californian and California Star, 1848 re: Gold Rush, and unidentified notes written on the reverse of wallpaper.

 Lamb, Notes re: her publications 15 9 Undated Lamb, Notes re: historical figures, events, places 15 10 Undated Notes from California newspapers, 1848 (not in Lamb's hand) including letters to ed, articles, ads, poetry 15 11 Undated Notes, unidentified. Includes fragments of a draft, on reverse of wallpaper (not in Lamb's hand) re: Napoleon's family 15 12 Undated Series XII. Financial Material, 1882-1891 Scope and Contents note

Bills and receipts, for professional and personal items.

 Bills and receipts 15 13 1882-1891 Series XIII. Genealogical Material, 1891-1892, undated (bulk undated) Scope and Contents note

For Lamb (Reade) plus various families, many New York State. An additional forty genealogies were transferred to the Library in 1957.

 Lamb: Reade family 16 1 Undated A -- J 16 2 Undated K -- S, unidentified 16 3 1891-1892, undated Series XIV. Ephemera, 1873-1890, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes ads for Lamb's publications, including History of the City of New York (also partial list of subscribers) and Magazine of American History, as well as various ads for hotels, building lots, household items, books, and book accessories. Also included are calling cards, tickets and notices of concerts and lectures, admission tickets to the Fifth Avenue Reading Room and the Tombs, and invitations to graduations and a wedding.

 Ads for Lamb publications 16 4 1884-1885, undated Ads 16 5 1873-1875,undated Calling cards 16 6 Undated Tickets and notices 16 7 1877-1879, undated Invitations 16 8 1878, 1890 Series XV. Excursion: Marietta, Ohio, 1888 Scope and Contents note

From July 15 -- 20, 1888, Lamb attended the "National Centennial of the Establishment of Civil Government in the 'Territory North West of the River Ohio' and of the First Settlement thereof under the Ordinance of 1787" at Marietta, Ohio. This series includes programs, correspondence, circulars, publications, clippings, and a B & O R.R. timetable relating to the excursion. Lamb's article about the centennial can be found in the Magazine of American History, Sept., 1888.

 Programs, correspondence, circulars, publications, timetable 16 9 1888, undated Clippings, mostly from Marietta Register 16 10 1888, undated Series XVI. Copies of documents, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes a copy of the 1776 diary of Dr. James Clitherall, extracts from diaries and letters of Rev. Horace Holley, and an unidentified author's firsthand account of the Chicago fire, 1871. These items do not appear to be Magazine of American History submissions. Lamb's editorial notations can be found on some; their use by her is unclear.

 Dr. James Clitherallcopy of diary, 1776 (possibly sent to Lamb by G. Woodbridge, Marietta, OH, 1890) 16 11 Undated Rev. Horace Holleyextracts from letters and diary re: Yale, Columbia, Princeton 16 12 Undated Rev. Horace Holley copies of letters from New York, 1818 16 12 Undated Rev. Horace Holleycopy of letter re: visit to Mt. Vernon, 1818 16 12 Undated Rev. Horace Holleycopies of letters from Edward Everett re: Kean riots of Boston, 1825 16 12 Undated Copy of document re: Chicago fire, 1871, author unknown 16 12 Undated Series XVII. Huntington Collection catalog, 1883 Scope and Contents note

Catalog of the Huntington Collection at the Metropolitan Museum.

 Huntington Collection, Metropolitan Museum. On microfilm, Misc. reel #46 16 13 1883 Series XVIII. Visual Materials, [18]81, 1886, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes photographs, glass negatives, sketches, prints, tintypes, printing blocks, and colored prints. Ten items are housed in Oversize cabinets (Ov), call phrase Y-Lamb, folder *3. Printing blocks are housed separately, in Box 18.

 Cabinet cards, portraits, Lamb (5) 17 1 Undated Cased photograph, portrait, subject unknown (possibly relative) 17 1 Undated Sketches, prints, stereographs, photograph of coastal scenes for possible use with Lamb's "American Life Saving Service" ( Harper's Feb. 1882) (10 items) 17 2 [18]81, undated Sketch of New York harbor on tissue paper 17 3 Undated Print, map of Europe at the time of Charlemagne (possibly used for MAH) 17 3 Undated Print, Earl of Beaconsfield (torn into many pieces) 17 3 Undated Prints, Nash coat of arms (numerous copies) 17 4 Undated Glass negatives, library scene (5) 17 5 Undated Tintypes (10), sketched portraits and scenes (probably for MAH) 17 6 Undated Printing blocks (5) coats of arms, signatures 18 Undated Wooden block with sketch, possibly Erie Canal opening celebration 18 Undated Colored prints (3), owls and blue jays Ov *3 Undated Sketches of Louisbourg, Nova Scotia (7) Ov *3 1886, undated Series XIX. Artifacts, 1881, undated Scope and Contents note

Includes souvenir rocks and heather, a key, wax seals, a miniature easel, a book cover, and cardboard. One item housed in Oversize cabinets (Ov), call phrase Y-Lamb, folder *1.

 Small cache of rocks from Trenton Falls, NY, with notes and wrapping (includes Hoosac Tunnel Route R.R. timetable) 17 7 1881,undated Sprig of heather, "picked by Mrs Stedman, near Walter Scotts place" 17 8 Undated Small key, "top drawer in cheffonier" [sic] 17 9 Undated Small easel with brush, possibly place-card, inscribed "Mrs. Lamb May 13th 1881." 17 9 1881 Three wax seals, coats of arms 17 9 Undated Common school book cover, note on cover "Material for October Number" 17 10 Undated Mailing tube, from the Historical Society of Tennessee 10 Undated Box lid with list of correspondents Ov *1 Undated
